title: SoC RTVF 360-0-22 Topics in Media Writing

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Writing the Dramedy Pilot

A popular style of modern television writing (Transparent, High Maintenance, Atlanta), the "dramedy," has the strong character components of a comedy while combining the engaging story components of a drama. In this class, we will respond to essays, watch video examples and study the art and craft of the dram-com approach. Students will also examine the process of developing, outlining, and writing a dramedy television series, building their own dynamic characters and locations through the making of a final original script.

Evaluation method: Class participation, in-class writing exercises, television treatment and thirty page teleplay.

Class materials: none

Class notes: All script examples will be available via CANVAS and all video examples will be shown in class or be available for viewing online via CANVAS.
